phrases: So how has living here been?
Oh, this is a wonderful House.
All the children are smart and well-behaved.
I see.
Lately you have been following instructions and being well-behaved as well.
Yes.
You try to get along with the children, and play tag with all your strength.
I was worried because you were a tomboy, but it looks like you are fine.
You are insurance.
Insurance that I called for, just in case, to make sure the products are protected.
So you do not need to know which one knows the secret,
and just pretend to be obedient, work hard,
and laugh that you have grasped some sort of weakness over me.
I would not think of...
You have nothing else to do than be my pawn, right?
If you behave...
I will make sure that you become a Mom.
I promise.
You are a smart girl.
Do not make any more mistakes from now on.
That woman!
Just you watch!
I will drag you down!
And then...
I will be Mom.
Emma.
Starting today, let us play tag in teams.
In teams?
At this rate, most of them would die if they escaped individually.
Hey, Ray.
But everyone is movements are not bad.
So we should not break them up individually.
We will make formations and run away in teams.
We will play tag in a way that is similar to what the real escape would be like.
The real escape.
And I have another idea.
Let us tell Don and Gilda.
We will explain the situation and have them lead the teams.
What if they are Mom's informant?
No worries.
Finding out who the informant is, and also winning them over.
I can do them simultaneously.
And I have already made arrangements.
Emma.
For now, I will tell you 100 types of formation patterns, so memorize them.
You mean by ear?
You cannot do it?
Easy peasy!
- I will not get caught this time!
- Good luck.
Okay, try not to get caught for 10 minutes.
Start.
Everyone, follow me!
Let us succeed and surprise Ray!
Let us do this!
That was fun!
Phil, you were good at running away.
This is really fun!
I want to be leader for the next one!
But let us take a break for a little bit.
It looks like playing tag in teams is going to work!
What was Phil's score again?
Let us see.
He is averaging about 203 lately.
That is high.
He was one of the last ones remaining this time and also when we played tag with Sister.
He is always looking for you and Norman with Sherry, too.
Stop it!
I do not want to suspect anyone after all!
Idiot.
Even if you do not want to, you need to be more suspicious!
Thoroughly!
This is life or death.
Ray.
Any progress on how to break the tracking devices?
How long do you need until you are prepared?
Let us see.
Ten days.
Then let us commence the plan ten days from now.
We will carry out the escape plan ten days from now, on November 8th.
W-Wait!
Is not it too soon?
I mean, it is fine, but...
It is not fine!
It is been two weeks since Conny was shipped.
The shipment cycle is at least two months, so we should have about a month and a half.
I thought the plan was to carefully prepare during that time!
Yeah.
Just as you thought that way, Mom's controlling us to think that way, too.
So we need to outwit that.
And if we fail from being too rushed?
Then what?
Either way, we need to escape before winter comes.
As soon as we break the tracking devices, let us execute our escape plan as quickly as possible.
That means we have to do what is necessary in the remaining ten days.
Let us talk to Don and Gilda tonight.
Both of you, follow my lead.
What did you want to talk about?
What?
Human trafficking?
Yeah.
All of our siblings have been sold off to bad people.
There is no way!
No way!
But the walls, the gate, and the siblings who left and never write us letters...
Oh come on, now.
So what is the punch line?
What kind of prank is this?
You are not saying it is true, are you?
It is true.
Wait.
Then what about Mom?
She is the one...
who is selling us to bad people.
There is no way that kind Mom would do such a thing!
Take it back, Emma!
Don.
Emma loves this House and Mom.
So there is no way she would lie about that.
Gilda.
And I did think it was weird.
The night Conny left...
Emma and Norman went to the gate, and...
You did?
Even if you broke the rules,
both of you would usually apologize immediately, and everything would be back to normal.
But you have not done that.
Emma, you have become so serious now.
So I could not ask about it.
I am sorry.
I am sorry, Gilda.
I made you worry.
Did you see it, Emma?
Conny being sold off...
to those bad people.
Yeah.
But we did not make it in time.
Conny is safe, right?
I do not know.
But how...
How could this even happen?
I do not know if this proves anything,
but these are our siblings' scores that I had Ray and Emma look into for the past few days.
Scores?
The ones who left are over six years old and adopted in the order of lowest scores first.
Is not that weird?
True, Conny's scores are...
And Hao and Sadie...
You are right, Norman.
Don. Gilda.
Let us escape from here and go help Conny and the others.
Let us all run away from here, together!
Please help us.
Hey, Norman.
Is this about the shipment?
What do you mean you do not know?
You should have said they died!
That was the best way to smoothly get them to help us.
If they were not the spies after all...
then this kind of lie is too cruel.
They are alive?
Do not give them hope that does not exist.
How and when are you going to tell them the truth?
Can you tell them?
I will cross that bridge when I get there.
We are still assuming they might be the spies, too.
So I am going to lay a trap.
A trap?
I will tell both of them where the rope is hidden.
I will tell Don it is under my bed.
To Gilda, I will tell her it is in the ceiling of the second floor bathroom.
Who will make a move?
How will Mom find out?
We can trace it from there.
And the ropes?
If they were not the spies, and there is nothing there, it will get complicated.
I have something else for that, too.
So you are completely prepared, huh?
I told you.
We have to outwit her.
Come back here!
It is been a while since we talked like this.
It is weird, right?
Even though we are together every day.
And we will be together from now on, too, right?
Yeah.
I see.
The rope is hidden in Norman's bed.
I have been waiting for you, Gilda.
Now, please talk to me, Gilda.
About that issue, right?
There is not anything I am worried about.
I appreciate that you frequently checked on me out of concern.
That is right, I am worried.
But I am okay now.
So you can leave me alone.
Please excuse me.
I see.
Emma told you everything, then?
Gilda, so you know about everything now, do not you?
Darn, it is too bad, Gilda.
I thought we could become friends.
So who else knows?
Norman.
Ray.
And?
I will let only you go, so why do not we join hands?
Please stop!
I do not know what you are talking about!
I just had a fight with Emma.
But we made up, so everything's okay now!
I see.
So it was my misunderstanding.
I apologize.
If you think Emma has lied to you, come back to me.
I will see you later, Gilda.
Emma.
Gilda.
I am not giving up.
If I cannot get Gilda...
The great Thoma has arrived!
I wonder if it is okay?
Let us go.
Mom's watching.
According to what Emma told me, Gilda is innocent.
Hey, Ray.
I wonder why traitors betray others.
Maybe it is because there must be some merit in doing so.
For example, they can be spared from being shipped out and can become an adult.
A guarantee to live, huh?
I see, so this was training for running away.
One, two...
Three...
Emma.
Can I talk to you?
I would like to hear your opinion.
What if there is someone who is willingly being an agent of the demons,
and that by spying on us, they are guaranteed to continue living...
You mean, in exchange for spying on us, they will not get shipped out and can live?
Would you leave that person behind?
Or take them with us?
I would take them with us.
Even if that person did not want that?
Yeah.
I would force them to come with us.
Because if we escape, that person's life might not be guaranteed anymore.
Also, I want to believe, after all.
The incident with Gilda made me realize that.
Ray told me to suspect everyone, but even if there is a traitor who is a demon's agent,
no one within our siblings is a bad person.
We are family that grew up together.
Even if that person gets in the way, betrays us, or says I am naIve,
I want to believe in that person!
Of course you would say that, Emma.
So?
Nothing.
Seriously?
Then it is confirmed that it is Don.
Yeah.
So you are the traitor, Ray.
